title: 107_hr5404
content: The "Social Security Fairness Act of 2002" is cited as the short title. Section 202 of the Social Security Act is amended to include a new subsection regarding the termination of the last monthly insurance benefit payment upon death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust the monthly insurance benefit payment for individuals who die within the first 15 days of a month. The payment is set at 50% of the benefit amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Additionally, procedures for benefit payments in the month of an individual's death are outlined in section 204(d). In cases where an individual dies in the first 15 days of a month, their monthly insurance benefit will be 50% of the original amount, rounded up to the nearest dollar. This adjustment applies after all other benefit adjustments have been made. Benefit payments in the month of the individual's death will follow the procedures outlined in section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. Exemption from maximum benefit cap for individuals under specific sections upon death. Increase in lump-sum death payments. The Social Security Act is amended to increase the lump-sum death payment to $955 for any calendar year, with adjustments made by the Commissioner of Social Security in subsequent years. The applicable dollar amount for any calendar year is $955, determined by the Commissioner of Social Security based on the national average wage index. If the calculated amount is not a multiple of $5.00, it will be rounded up to the nearest higher multiple of $5.00. The applicable dollar amount for any calendar year is $955, determined by the Commissioner of Social Security based on the national average wage index. It will be rounded to the next higher multiple of $5.00 if it is a multiple of $2.50 but not of $5.00, and to the nearest multiple of $5.00 in any other case. The amendments made by this Act will apply to deaths occurring after 90 days from the enactment date.
